name: elmapfun
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: ffund(c0, c2, c1, wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wfun(c0))
-| wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(c0, c2, c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wfun(c0))
-| wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(c0, c2, c1))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(c0, c2, c1))

comment: A mapping is always a function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Oct-2014.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 5-May-2015.)
